content: मानः [मन्-घञ्] {@--1@} Respect, honour, regard, respectful consideration; दारिद्र्यस्य परा मूर्तिर्यन्मानद्रविणाल्पता <ls>Pt. 2. 159</ls>: <ls>Bg. 6. 7</ls>; so मानधन &c. {@--2@} Pride (in a good sense), self-reliance, self respect; जन्मिनो मानहीनस्य तृणस्य च समा गतिः <ls>Pt. 1. 106</ls>; <ls>R. 16. 81.</ls> {@--3@} Haughtiness, pride, conceit, self-confidence. {@--4@} A wounded sense of honour. {@--5@} Jealous anger, anger excited by jealousy (especially in women); anger in general. मुच मयि मानमनिदानं <ls>Gīt. 10</ls>; माधवे मा कुरु मानिनि मानमये <ls n="Gīt.">9</ls>; त्यजत मानमलं बत विग्रहैः <ls>R. 9. 47</ls>; <ls>Śi. 9. 84</ls>; <ls>Bv. 2. 56.</ls> {@--6@} Opinion, conception. {@--7@} <ab>Ved.</ab> Object, purpose. --नं [मा-ल्युट्] {@--1@} Measuring. {@--2@} A measure, standard {@--3@} Dimension, computation. {@--4@} A standard of measure, measuring-rod, rule. {@--5@} Proof, authority, means of proof or demonstration: येऽमी माधुर्यौजः प्रमादा रसमात्रवर्मतयोक्तास्तपां रसधर्मत्वे किं मानं <ls>R. G.</ls>; मानाभावात् (frequently occurring in controversial language) <ls>Pad. D. 4. 3.</ls> {@--6@} Likeness, resemblance.
